comments:
Pleasse follow this test case:

1. Start Eclipse (i have 3.2 RC4, WTP 1.5 RC3 + JSF M3), create new empty workspace.
2. Help -> About Eclipse SDK -> Configuration Details -> View error log - button is disabled, all is OK.
3. Window -> Preferences -> Web and XML -> JSF Libraries, add libraries JSF/JSTL/Commons, as described in tutorial.
4. Exit Eclipse, restart it, select previously created workspace.
5. Help -> About Eclipse SDK -> Configuration Details -> View error log,
there is problem:

!SESSION 2006-06-01 10:27:50.890 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20060512-1600
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=cs_CZ
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jst.jsf.core 1 0 2006-06-01 10:29:46.187
!MESSAGE Could not load JSF Library Registry; creating new registry
!STACK 0
java.io.FileNotFoundException: G:\TestXxx\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.jst.jsf.core\JSFLibraryRegistry.xml (System cannot find path)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:106)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.URIConverterImpl.createFileInputStream(URIConverterImpl.java:469)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.URIConverterImpl.createInputStream(URIConverterImpl.java:431)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.load(ResourceImpl.java:892)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.core.internal.JSFCorePlugin.loadJSFLibraryRegistry(JSFCorePlugin.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.core.internal.JSFCorePlugin.start(JSFCorePlugin.java:83)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl$2.run(BundleContextImpl.java:995)
...CUT

Created an attachment (id=43221)
screenshot

JSFLibraryRegistry.xml is found on the path, but exception occured

The stack trace was for information purpose.  JSFLibraryRegistry.xml is created after stack trace is logged.  

A fix is checked in to remove the stack trace from log.  
Another bug, 14497, was created for this and should be noted as duplicated for 
this bug.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 14497 ***
